dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1460 IS: Preserving Patient Access to Accountable Care Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Barrasso (for himself, Mr. Whitehouse, Mr. Cassidy, Mr. Welch, Mr. Tillis, and Mrs. Blackburn) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend incentive payments for participation in eligible alternative payment models under the Medicare program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preserving Patient Access to Accountable Care Act.

section.header: Extending incentive payments for participation in eligible alternative payment models

subsection.text: Section 1833(z) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395l(z)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking with 2026 and inserting with 2027; and
by inserting , or, with respect to 2027, 3.53 percent after 1.88 percent;

clause.text: in the subsection heading, by striking 2026 and inserting 2027; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2026 and inserting 2027;
in the subparagraph heading, by striking 2027 and inserting 2028; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2027 and inserting 2028; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking and 2026 and inserting 2026, and 2027; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4)(B), by inserting , or, with respect to 2027, 3.53 percent after 1.88 percent.

subsection.text: Section 1848(q)(1)(C)(iii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–4(q)(1)(C)(iii)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subclause (II), by striking 2026 and inserting 2027; and
in subclause (III), by striking 2027 and inserting 2028.
